description: Kopegaron Woods Conservation Area, managed by the Essex Region Conservation Authority, is a 19-hectare Carolinian forest site located on Talbot Road in Wheatley, Ontario. The area features a 1 km moderate trail with boardwalks and natural terrain, ideal for hiking, birdwatching, photography, picnicking, dog walking, and geocaching. Facilities include picnic tables and portable washrooms.
This conservation area is particularly known for spring wildflower blooms along the boardwalk.
The Woods is one of Ontario's 300 conservation areas, built and maintained in an effort to preserve natural habitats and promote biodiversity.
Photo by Howard Walsh via Flickr, public domain.
